alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 1:19PM MST until March 23 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by earlier upstream rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Arizona, including the following county, Maricopa. * WHEN...Until 945 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of normally dry river beds and pedestrian crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 118 PM MST, stream gauge reports indicated elevated water levels along the New River. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - The gauges at New River Dam outlet and New River at Bell Rd are above alarm stage. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... in the Peoria area, pedestrian crossings in the riverbed near Thunderbird Road, Grand and Northern Avenues. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. Only six inches of fast-flowing water can knock you off your feet!
